status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
liurenjie1024 commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806
 
 
   Currently rust Buffer always assume that the memory passed to it is owned by itself, and frees the memory when Buffer is dropped. This is inconvenient when used in cross language environments such as jni. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

sunchao commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r345949107
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -96,11 +99,18 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 impl Buffer {
     /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::from_raw_parts_owned(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// This differs from `from_raw_parts` in that user can provide an argument to indicate
+    /// whether this piece of memory is owned by this buffer.
+    pub fn from_raw_parts_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize, owned: bool) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   nit: can we have another method `from_owned` which will not keep ownership of the passed in buffer? and then we can make this function private.
   
   Also we might want to add extra doc for `from_raw_parts` indicating that it takes the ownership of the input buffer.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

liurenjie1024 commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r348876267
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -96,11 +99,18 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 impl Buffer {
     /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::from_raw_parts_owned(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// This differs from `from_raw_parts` in that user can provide an argument to indicate
+    /// whether this piece of memory is owned by this buffer.
+    pub fn from_raw_parts_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize, owned: bool) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   Sorry for late reply since I have been on vacation. I think a better solution is to deprecate this method and add other methods with better names(from_owned_raw_parts, from_unowned_raw_parts).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

sunchao commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r348886310
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -96,11 +99,18 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 impl Buffer {
     /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::from_raw_parts_owned(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// This differs from `from_raw_parts` in that user can provide an argument to indicate
+    /// whether this piece of memory is owned by this buffer.
+    pub fn from_raw_parts_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize, owned: bool) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   I'm -0 on deprecating the existing one merely because of a name change. On the other hand, I don't really like the name `from_owned_raw_parts` and `from_unowned_raw_parts` - they are too long and the `raw_parts` is just unnecessary. Why don't we call them `from_owned` and `from_unowned`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

sunchao commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r349721650
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -94,13 +97,40 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 }
 
 impl Buffer {
-    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    ///
+    /// This method is the same as `from_owned`.
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::build_with_arguments(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    pub fn from_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   Should we just keep one method? Having two method with the same name is slightly confusing. For instance, someone may use both methods in their code for some reason which makes reading more difficult. 
   
   I think the naming is not an issue as long as we make sure the method is well-documented.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this

     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {

+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    pub fn from_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   Do we need this? Having two method with the same name is slightly confusing. For instance, someone may use both methods in their code for some reason which makes reading more difficult. 
   
   I think the naming is not an issue as long as we make sure the method is well-documented.

liurenjie1024 commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r349875596
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -94,13 +97,40 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 }
 
 impl Buffer {
-    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    ///
+    /// This method is the same as `from_owned`.
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::build_with_arguments(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    pub fn from_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   I agree that two methods with same functionality is slightly confusing. But I think `from_owned` is better than `from_raw_parts` because this naming style is more consistent with `from_unowned`, that's also why I deprecate `from_raw_parts` at first. If we should only keep one, I'd prefer to keep `from_owned`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

sunchao commented on pull request #5806: ARROW-7113: [Rust] Add unowned buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5806#discussion_r349881372
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs
 ##########
 @@ -94,13 +97,40 @@ impl Debug for BufferData {
 }
 
 impl Buffer {
-    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned)
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    ///
+    /// This method is the same as `from_owned`.
     pub fn from_raw_parts(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
+        Buffer::build_with_arguments(ptr, len, true)
+    }
+
+    /// Creates a buffer from an existing memory region (must already be byte-aligned), and this
+    /// buffer will free this piece of memory when dropped.
+    pub fn from_owned(ptr: *const u8, len: usize) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   Yes,`from_owned` sounds slightly better than `from_raw_parts`, but I don't think it's worth having two methods with the same functionality (which will cause confusion), or deprecating the current one. In fact taking ownership of the incoming memory should be the default behavior so this `owned` part is also not really necessary.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Currently rust Buffer always assume that the memory passed to it is owned by itself, and frees the memory when Buffer is dropped. This is inconvenient when used in cross language environments such as jni.
fields.summary: [Rust] Buffer should accept memory owned by others
